Sure! According to the Mandaeans, St. John the Baptist was not only a prophet but also a savior who performed many miracles. Here are a few of the miracles that they believe he performed:

1. Healing the sick: The Mandaeans believe that St. John the Baptist had the power to heal people of various illnesses and afflictions. For example, he is said to have healed a woman who had been paralyzed for 38 years by placing his hand on her and proclaiming the name of the deity.

2. Resurrecting the dead: The Mandaeans believe that St. John the Baptist was able to bring people back to life through his power. In one story, he is said to have resurrected a man who had drowned in a river and had been dead for three days.

3. Turning water into wine: The Mandaeans believe that St. John the Baptist had the power to transform water into wine. In one story, he attends a wedding feast where the wine has run out, and he uses his powers to create more wine for the guests.

4. Fighting demons: The Mandaeans believe that St. John the Baptist was able to defeat demons and other evil spirits. In one story, he is said to have battled a group of demons who were tormenting a village, and he ultimately succeeded in driving them away.

These miracles and others like them are central to the Mandaeans' beliefs about St. John the Baptist and his power as a savior. The stories are often passed down through oral tradition and are considered an important part of their religious heritage.
